intro: Lopezia miniata, commonly known as the small-flowered Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, delicate yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and sandy plains. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lopezia miniata is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
